guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for irinotecan and UGT1A1

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299190

text.html: NO action is needed for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: This genetic variation (IM) is more common in Western populations than the wild-type (*1/*1). This means that treatment is largely geared to patients with this genetic variation. Adjustment of the treatment is therefore not useful.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166303201

text.html:
Start with 70% of the normal dose If the patient tolerates this initial dose, the dose can be increased, guided by the neutrophil count.

The normal dose is defined as the dose the patient would receive if he/she would not have a gene variant.

implications: Serious, life-threatening adverse events occur more often in patients with this genetic variation. The genetic variation reduces conversion of irinotecan to inactive metabolites.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299189

text.html: NO action is needed for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: This genetic variation (*1/*28) is more common in Western populations than the wild-type (*1/*1). This means that treatment is largely geared to patients with this genetic variation. Adjustment of the treatment is therefore not useful. Note that DPWG considers the *36 allele to be clinically equivalent to the *1 allele.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299188

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for irinotecan in normal metabolizers

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on irinotecan.
